pull.title: util: Add SaturatingAdd helper
pull.body:
Seems good to have this in the repo, as it might be needed to write cleaner code. For example:

* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24090#issuecomment-1019948200
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23418#discussion_r744953272
* ...

events.body: Concept ACK. This seems useful, hopefully C++ will have built-ins for explicitly saturating/wrapping/checked arithmetic like rust some day. But until then…

> saturating/wrapping/checked arithmetic like rust

I wasn't aware that rust has those built-in. Mind sharing a link to the docs?

Oh, I see. By default rust will panic, but there are https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/num/index.html:

* https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/num/struct.Saturating.html
* https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/num/struct.Wrapping.html

verification.payload:
tree 8826fb85e35da9fb2bee74a5da27cbf39b0c1b2a
parent 1337b93f50d9874fa3bce7c0b5bb141aad9b1c49
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1643719422 +0100
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1645450373 +0100

util: Add SaturatingAdd helper

events.body: Added a test. Should be trivial to re-ACK with `git range-diff bitcoin-core/master fa90189cbf faa7d8a3f7`

comments.body: Out of curiosity, any reason you didn't `constexpr` this function?
Outside of unit tests I don't think this will ever be called in a context that would be constexpr.

Maybe add a test like:
```cpp
BOOST_CHECK_EQUAL(MAXI - 1, SaturatingAdd(T{1}, MAXI - 2));
```
to ensure that `SaturatingAdd()` does not always, or too often, return `MAXI`. Or, keeps being accurate close to the limit.

(same for `MINI + 1` tests below)
